Package application

Class MyStage

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • application.World
              • application.MyStage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class MyStage
extends World
    Defines the main logic for the program and contains all the graphics. A singleton design pattern is used to ensure that you can never have more than one of these at any given point in time.
    Author:
    psyjpf

      • MyStage

        private MyStage​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the private constructor for the object.
        Parameters:
        stage - Defines the parent container for this pane.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - constructing can throw an error which is contained here.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanceSingelton

        public static MyStage getInstanceSingelton​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Gets a single instance of the object or creates a new one if one does not exist.
        Parameters:
        stage - The main stage reference needed to create a MyStage object
        Returns:
        a single instance of My Stage using a singleton to ensure not more than one is ever created.

      • getInstanceSingelton

        public static MyStage getInstanceSingelton()
        Returns:
        A reference to the object, ensures never more than one.

      • change

        public void change​(GenerateLevel newLevel,
                   java.lang.Integer lives)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Used for if you want to change levels to a new level in the main menu screen
        Parameters:
        newLevel - The new level for which you wish to load.
        lives - The number of lives the player has on the level.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The error message which can be generated when changing.

      • change

        public void change​(java.lang.String newScene)
        Change the view to any FMXL file, for example the info screen and high score scene.
        Parameters:
        newScene - - the name of the FXML file for which the program needs to switch too/ display.

      • scoreBoardShow

        public void scoreBoardShow​(java.lang.String level,
                           java.lang.Integer score)
        Displays the score board on screen to the player to view.
        Parameters:
        level - What score board you want to display/ for what level
        score - What score the user got that they might want to enter into the scoreboard file.

      • loadFXML

        public javafx.scene.Parent loadFXML​(java.lang.String fxml)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Used to load up a new window from a custom .FXML file.
        Parameters:
        fxml - The file name for what you want to load.
        Returns:
        The parsed FXml document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the error which can be generated when loading an FXML file.

      • playMusic

        public void playMusic()
        Begins the BackgroundImage music for the game.

      • stopMusic

        public void stopMusic()
        Stops the Background music for the game.

      • getLevel

        public Game getLevel()
        Used only for unit testing
        Returns:
        the level which is currently being displayed on the main stage.
